displaytitle: Reclining figure with hands in the gesture of prayer, seen from below
medium: Pen, brown and dark brown ink and gray-brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Reclining figure with hands in the gesture of prayer, seen from below

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Possibly until 1852, Count Algarotti-Corniani, Venice, Italy.

possibly 1852, bought by Edward Cheney, Badger Hall, Shropshire;

29 April, 1885, Cheney Sale, Sotheby’s, lot 1024.

14 July, 1914, Christie's, lot 49.

1922, purchased by E. Parsons & Sons, London;

between 1922-1926, purchased by Dan Fellows Platt;

Bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum

bibliography.boilertext: George Knox, "Drawings by Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo at Princeton", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 23, no. 1 (1964): p. 2-28.
bibliography.citation: George Knox, "Drawings by Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo at Princeton", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 23, no. 1 (1964): p. 2-28., p. 11, no. 34; p. 15 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 192, no. 609 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

bibliography.boilertext: George P. Mras, "Some drawings by G. B. Tiepolo", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 15, no. 2 (1956): p. 39-59.
bibliography.citation: George P. Mras, "Some drawings by G. B. Tiepolo", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 15, no. 2 (1956): p. 39-59., fig. 15, p. 49 (illus.)
